Authors:
Ylenia Chiari, Michael Veith, Arie Van der Meijden, Mauro
Mucedda, Salvador Carranza, Claudia Corti
Title:
Phylogenetic relationships of Sardinian cave salamanders,
genus Hydromantes, based on mitochondrial and nuclear DNA sequence
data
Abstract:
A phylogeny of the European members of the genus
Hydromantes, based on three mitochondrial (12S, 16S, Cytochrome b) and
two nuclear genes (Rag-1, BDNF) for 27 populations resolved all eight
currently recognized species as monophyletic clades. Relationships among
the three main clades, the mainland clade (Hydromantes (Speleomantes)
strinatii, H. (S.) ambrosii and H. (S.) italicus), the Eastern Sardinian
clade (H. (S.) flavus, H. (S.) supramontis, H. (S.) imperialis and H.
(S.) sarrabusensis) and H. (Atylodes) genei from south-west Sardinia,
remain poorly resolved. Genetic distances show high levels of
differentiation within H. (A.) genei and H. (S.) imperialis.
